intro: Gouania canescens, commonly known as the hairy gouania, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Gouania canescens is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
